stimulusHtml: A negatively charged sphere is launched from the ground at an angle of 30° above the horizontal with initial speed v0. Under the influence of only gravity, the sphere reaches a maximum height h with speed vh. A uniform electric field directed downward is turned on in the region of the sphere’s path, and the sphere is then launched from the ground with the same speed and angle. Which of the following is true of the new maximum height of the sphere and its speed at that height compared to the first launch?
choicesHtml: The new maximum height of the sphere is lower than h, and the speed of the sphere at the new maximum height is less than vh.
The new maximum height of the sphere is lower than h, and the speed of the sphere at the new maximum height is equal to vh.
The new maximum height of the sphere is higher than h, and the speed of the sphere at the new maximum height is greater than vh.
The new maximum height of the sphere is higher than h, and the speed of the sphere at the new maximum height is equal to vh.
